en: Jesus told his disciples a story.
It speaks about wealth, suffering, and what follows this life.

lines: There was a rich man who lived in luxury every day.
At his gate was laid a beggar named Lazarus,
longing to eat what fell from the rich man’s table.
The time came when the beggar died,
and the angels carried him to Abraham’s side.
The rich man also died and was buried.
In Hades, where he was in torment,
he looked up and saw Abraham far away,

label.en: Father Abraham, Have Pity on Me

lines: to dip the tip of his finger in water
because I am in agony in this fire.’
but now he is comforted here
between us and you a great chasm has been fixed,
so that those who want to go from here to you cannot,
nor can anyone cross over from there to us.’

label.en: Listen to Moses and the Prophets

lines: send Lazarus to my father’s house,
so that they will not also come
‘but if someone from the dead goes to them,
‘If they do not listen to Moses and the Prophets,
even if someone rises from the dead.’

question.en: What do you notice about the warning in this story—and about the importance of listening to Moses and the Prophets?
